001package imagingbook.pub.geometry.delaunay.chew;

003import imagingbook.pub.geometry.basic.Pnt2d;

025/**
026 * Points in Euclidean space, implemented as double[].
027 *
028 * Includes simple geometric operations.
029 * Uses matrices; a matrix is represented as an array of Pnts.
030 * Uses simplices; a simplex is represented as an array of Pnts.
031 *
032 * @author Paul Chew
033 *
034 * Created July 2005.  Derived from an earlier, messier version.
035 *
036 * Modified Novemeber 2007.  Minor clean up.
037 * 
038 * Adapted by W. Burger (2019)
039 * @version 2020-01-01
040 * 
041 */
042public class Pnt implements Pnt2d {
043
044    private double[] coordinates;          // The point's coordinates
045    
046    public Pnt(Pnt2d p) {
047        this(p.getX(), p.getY());
048    }
049    
050
051    /**
052     * Constructor.
053     * @param coords the coordinates
054     */
055    public Pnt (double... coords) {
056        // Copying is done here to ensure that Pnt's coords cannot be altered.
057        // This is necessary because the double... notation actually creates a
058        // constructor with double[] as its argument.
059        //        coordinates = new double[coords.length];
060        //        System.arraycopy(coords, 0, coordinates, 0, coords.length);
061        coordinates = coords.clone();
062    }
063    
064    // -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
065
066    @Override
067    public String toString () {
068        if (coordinates.length == 0) return "Pnt()";
069        String result = "Pnt(" + coordinates[0];
070        for (int i = 1; i < coordinates.length; i++)
071            result = result + "," + coordinates[i];
072        result = result + ")";
073        return result;
074    }
075
076    @Override
077    public boolean equals (Object other) {
078        if (!(other instanceof Pnt)) return false;
079        Pnt p = (Pnt) other;
080        if (this.coordinates.length != p.coordinates.length) return false;
081        for (int i = 0; i < this.coordinates.length; i++)
082            if (this.coordinates[i] != p.coordinates[i]) return false;
083        return true;
084    }
085
086    @Override
087    public int hashCode () {
088        int hash = 0;
089        for (double c: this.coordinates) {
090            long bits = java.lang.Double.doubleToLongBits(c);
091            hash = (31*hash) ^ (int)(bits ^ (bits >> 32));
092        }
093        return hash;
094    }
095
096    /* Pnts as vectors */
097
098    /**
099     * Returns the specified coordinate of this point/vector.
100     * @param i the coordinate index (0, 1, ...)
101     * @return as described
102     */
103    public double coord (int i) {
104        return this.coordinates[i];
105    }
106
107    /**
108     * @return this Pnt's dimension.
109     */
110    public int dimension () {
111        return coordinates.length;
112    }
113
114    /**
115     * Check that dimensions match.
116     * @param p the Pnt to check (against this Pnt)
117     * @return the dimension of the Pnts
118     * @throws IllegalArgumentException if dimension fail to match
119     */
120    public int dimCheck (Pnt p) {
121        int len = this.coordinates.length;
122        if (len != p.coordinates.length)
123            throw new IllegalArgumentException("Dimension mismatch");
124        return len;
125    }
126
127    /**
128     * Create a new Pnt by adding additional coordinates to this Pnt.
129     * @param coords the new coordinates (added on the right end)
130     * @return a new Pnt with the additional coordinates
131     */
132    public Pnt extend (double... coords) {
133        double[] result = new double[coordinates.length + coords.length];
134        System.arraycopy(coordinates, 0, result, 0, coordinates.length);
135        System.arraycopy(coords, 0, result, coordinates.length, coords.length);
136        return new Pnt(result);
137    }
138
139    /**
140     * Dot product.
141     * @param p the other Pnt
142     * @return dot product of this Pnt and p
143     */
144    public double dot (Pnt p) {
145        int len = dimCheck(p);
146        double sum = 0;
147        for (int i = 0; i < len; i++)
148            sum += this.coordinates[i] * p.coordinates[i];
149        return sum;
150    }
151
152    /**
153     * Magnitude (as a vector).
154     * @return the Euclidean length of this vector
155     */
156    public double magnitude () {
157        return Math.sqrt(this.dot(this));
158    }
159
160    /**
161     * Subtract.
162     * @param p the other Pnt
163     * @return a new Pnt = this - p
164     */
165    public Pnt subtract (Pnt p) {
166        int len = dimCheck(p);
167        double[] coords = new double[len];
168        for (int i = 0; i < len; i++)
169            coords[i] = this.coordinates[i] - p.coordinates[i];
170        return new Pnt(coords);
171    }
172
173    /**
174     * Add.
175     * @param p the other Pnt
176     * @return a new Pnt = this + p
177     */
178    public Pnt add (Pnt p) {
179        int len = dimCheck(p);
180        double[] coords = new double[len];
181        for (int i = 0; i < len; i++)
182            coords[i] = this.coordinates[i] + p.coordinates[i];
183        return new Pnt(coords);
184    }
185
186    /**
187     * Angle (in radians) between two Pnts (treated as vectors).
188     * @param p the other Pnt
189     * @return the angle (in radians) between the two Pnts
190     */
191    public double angle (Pnt p) {
192        return Math.acos(this.dot(p) / (this.magnitude() * p.magnitude()));
193    }
194
195    /**
196     * Perpendicular bisector of two Pnts.
197     * Works in any dimension.  The coefficients are returned as a Pnt of one
198     * higher dimension (e.g., (A,B,C,D) for an equation of the form
199     * Ax + By + Cz + D = 0).
200     * @param point the other point
201     * @return the coefficients of the perpendicular bisector
202     */
203    public Pnt bisector (Pnt point) {
204        dimCheck(point);
205        Pnt diff = this.subtract(point);
206        Pnt sum = this.add(point);
207        double dot = diff.dot(sum);
208        return diff.extend(-dot / 2);
209    }
210
211    /* Pnts as matrices */
212
213    /**
214     * Create a String for a matrix.
215     * @param matrix the matrix (an array of Pnts)
216     * @return a String represenation of the matrix
217     */
218    public static String toString (Pnt[] matrix) {
219        StringBuilder buf = new StringBuilder("{");
220        for (Pnt row: matrix) buf.append(" " + row);
221        buf.append(" }");
222        return buf.toString();
223    }
224
225    /**
226     * Compute the determinant of a matrix (array of Pnts).
227     * This is not an efficient implementation, but should be adequate
228     * for low dimension.
229     * @param matrix the matrix as an array of Pnts
230     * @return the determinnant of the input matrix
231     * @throws IllegalArgumentException if dimensions are wrong
232     */
233    public static double determinant (Pnt[] matrix) {
234        if (matrix.length != matrix[0].dimension())
235            throw new IllegalArgumentException("Matrix is not square");
236        boolean[] columns = new boolean[matrix.length];
237        for (int i = 0; i < matrix.length; i++) columns[i] = true;
238        try {return determinant(matrix, 0, columns);}
239        catch (ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException e) {
240            throw new IllegalArgumentException("Matrix is wrong shape");
241        }
242    }
243
244    /**
245     * Compute the determinant of a submatrix specified by starting row
246     * and by "active" columns.
247     * @param matrix the matrix as an array of Pnts
248     * @param row the starting row
249     * @param columns a boolean array indicating the "active" columns
250     * @return the determinant of the specified submatrix
251     * @throws ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException if dimensions are wrong
252     */
253    private static double determinant(Pnt[] matrix, int row, boolean[] columns){
254        if (row == matrix.length) return 1;
255        double sum = 0;
256        int sign = 1;
257        for (int col = 0; col < columns.length; col++) {
258            if (!columns[col]) continue;
259            columns[col] = false;
260            sum += sign * matrix[row].coordinates[col] *
261                   determinant(matrix, row+1, columns);
262            columns[col] = true;
263            sign = -sign;
264        }
265        return sum;
266    }
267
268    /**
269     * Compute generalized cross-product of the rows of a matrix.
270     * The result is a Pnt perpendicular (as a vector) to each row of
271     * the matrix.  This is not an efficient implementation, but should
272     * be adequate for low dimension.
273     * @param matrix the matrix of Pnts (one less row than the Pnt dimension)
274     * @return a Pnt perpendicular to each row Pnt
275     * @throws IllegalArgumentException if matrix is wrong shape
276     */
277    public static Pnt cross (Pnt[] matrix) {
278        int len = matrix.length + 1;
279        if (len != matrix[0].dimension())
280            throw new IllegalArgumentException("Dimension mismatch");
281        boolean[] columns = new boolean[len];
282        for (int i = 0; i < len; i++) columns[i] = true;
283        double[] result = new double[len];
284        int sign = 1;
285        try {
286            for (int i = 0; i < len; i++) {
287                columns[i] = false;
288                result[i] = sign * determinant(matrix, 0, columns);
289                columns[i] = true;
290                sign = -sign;
291            }
292        } catch (ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException e) {
293            throw new IllegalArgumentException("Matrix is wrong shape");
294        }
295        return new Pnt(result);
296    }
297
298    /* Pnts as simplices */
299
300    /**
301     * Determine the signed content (i.e., area or volume, etc.) of a simplex.
302     * @param simplex the simplex (as an array of Pnts)
303     * @return the signed content of the simplex
304     */
305    public static double content (Pnt[] simplex) {
306        Pnt[] matrix = new Pnt[simplex.length];
307        for (int i = 0; i < matrix.length; i++)
308            matrix[i] = simplex[i].extend(1);
309        int fact = 1;
310        for (int i = 1; i < matrix.length; i++) fact = fact*i;
311        return determinant(matrix) / fact;
312    }
313
314    /**
315     * Relation between this Pnt and a simplex (represented as an array of
316     * Pnts). Result is an array of signs, one for each vertex of the simplex,
317     * indicating the relation between the vertex, the vertex's opposite facet,
318     * and this Pnt.
319     * Throws a {@link IllegalArgumentException} if the simplex is degenerate.
320     *
321     * <pre>
322     *   -1 means Pnt is on same side of facet
323     *    0 means Pnt is on the facet
324     *   +1 means Pnt is on opposite side of facet
325     * </pre>
326     *
327     * @param simplex an array of Pnts representing a simplex
328     * @return an array of signs showing relation between this Pnt and simplex
329     */
330    public int[] relation (Pnt[] simplex) {
331        /* In 2D, we compute the cross of this matrix:
332         *    1   1   1   1
333         *    p0  a0  b0  c0
334         *    p1  a1  b1  c1
335         * where (a, b, c) is the simplex and p is this Pnt. The result is a
336         * vector in which the first coordinate is the signed area (all signed
337         * areas are off by the same constant factor) of the simplex and the
338         * remaining coordinates are the *negated* signed areas for the
339         * simplices in which p is substituted for each of the vertices.
340         * Analogous results occur in higher dimensions.
341         */
342        int dim = simplex.length - 1;
343        if (this.dimension() != dim)
344            throw new IllegalArgumentException("Dimension mismatch");
345
346        /* Create and load the matrix */
347        Pnt[] matrix = new Pnt[dim+1];
348        /* First row */
349        double[] coords = new double[dim+2];
350        for (int j = 0; j < coords.length; j++) coords[j] = 1;
351        matrix[0] = new Pnt(coords);
352        /* Other rows */
353        for (int i = 0; i < dim; i++) {
354            coords[0] = this.coordinates[i];
355            for (int j = 0; j < simplex.length; j++)
356                coords[j+1] = simplex[j].coordinates[i];
357            matrix[i+1] = new Pnt(coords);
358        }
359
360        /* Compute and analyze the vector of areas/volumes/contents */
361        Pnt vector = cross(matrix);
362        double content = vector.coordinates[0];
363        int[] result = new int[dim+1];
364        for (int i = 0; i < result.length; i++) {
365            double value = vector.coordinates[i+1];
366            if (Math.abs(value) <= 1.0e-6 * Math.abs(content)) result[i] = 0;
367            else if (value < 0) result[i] = -1;
368            else result[i] = 1;
369        }
370        if (content < 0) {
371            for (int i = 0; i < result.length; i++)
372                result[i] = -result[i];
373        }
374        if (content == 0) {
375            for (int i = 0; i < result.length; i++)
376                result[i] = Math.abs(result[i]);
377        }
378        return result;
379    }
380
381    /**
382     * Test if this Pnt is outside of simplex.
383     * @param simplex the simplex (an array of Pnts)
384     * @return simplex Pnt that "witnesses" outsideness (or null if not outside)
385     */
386    public Pnt isOutside (Pnt[] simplex) {
387        int[] result = this.relation(simplex);
388        for (int i = 0; i < result.length; i++) {
389            if (result[i] > 0) return simplex[i];
390        }
391        return null;
392    }
393
394    /**
395     * Test if this Pnt is on a simplex.
396     * @param simplex the simplex (an array of Pnts)
397     * @return the simplex Pnt that "witnesses" on-ness (or null if not on)
398     */
399    public Pnt isOn (Pnt[] simplex) {
400        int[] result = this.relation(simplex);
401        Pnt witness = null;
402        for (int i = 0; i < result.length; i++) {
403            if (result[i] == 0) witness = simplex[i];
404            else if (result[i] > 0) return null;
405        }
406        return witness;
407    }
408
409    /**
410     * Test if this Pnt is inside a simplex.
411     * @param simplex the simplex (an arary of Pnts)
412     * @return true iff this Pnt is inside simplex.
413     */
414    public boolean isInside (Pnt[] simplex) {
415        int[] result = this.relation(simplex);
416        for (int r: result) if (r >= 0) return false;
417        return true;
418    }
419
420    /**
421     * Test relation between this Pnt and circumcircle of a simplex.
422     * @param simplex the simplex (as an array of Pnts)
423     * @return -1, 0, or +1 for inside, on, or outside of circumcircle
424     */
425    public int vsCircumcircle (Pnt[] simplex) {
426        Pnt[] matrix = new Pnt[simplex.length + 1];
427        for (int i = 0; i < simplex.length; i++)
428            matrix[i] = simplex[i].extend(1, simplex[i].dot(simplex[i]));
429        matrix[simplex.length] = this.extend(1, this.dot(this));
430        double d = determinant(matrix);
431        int result = (d < 0)? -1 : ((d > 0)? +1 : 0);
432        if (content(simplex) < 0) result = - result;
433        return result;
434    }
435
436    /**
437     * Circumcenter of a simplex.
438     * @param simplex the simplex (as an array of Pnts)
439     * @return the circumcenter (a Pnt) of simplex
440     */
441    public static Pnt circumcenter (Pnt[] simplex) {
442        int dim = simplex[0].dimension();
443        if (simplex.length - 1 != dim)
444            throw new IllegalArgumentException("Dimension mismatch");
445        Pnt[] matrix = new Pnt[dim];
446        for (int i = 0; i < dim; i++)
447            matrix[i] = simplex[i].bisector(simplex[i+1]);
448        Pnt hCenter = cross(matrix);      // Center in homogeneous coordinates
449        double last = hCenter.coordinates[dim];
450        double[] result = new double[dim];
451        for (int i = 0; i < dim; i++) result[i] = hCenter.coordinates[i] / last;
452        return new Pnt(result);
453    }
454    
455    // methods required by {@link Point}:
456
457        @Override
458        public double getX() {
459                return this.coordinates[0];
460        }
461
462        @Override
463        public double getY() {
464                return this.coordinates[1];
465        }
466
